education.title: Computer Science — NTNU
education.description: A 5 years integrated master's degree at the Norwegian University of Science and Technology. I'm specializing in database systems, search engines and AI. I will finish the degree in spring 2022.

itCompanies.name: Strise
itCompanies.description: Interning as a front end developer. Strise aims to revolutionize enterprise software, and being a part of the team was a unique experience. I worked part time alongside my studies until May, and then continued as an intern during summer. My tasks naturally included a lot of bug squashing and refactoring, but also implementing new features and creating internal tools for efficiency. An example is making a Slack bot to add previews for links to the Strise products. You can read about that and more in a blogpost I wrote for Strise at this link.

itCompanies.name: NTNU
itCompanies.description: Student assistant in the course TDT4145: Data Modelling and Database Systems. It was a great joy helping other students professionally. I often ended up spending more time than I was paid for, just for the fun of it.

otherCompanies.name: NTNU
otherCompanies.description: Mentoring a student with a functional disability in the courses TMA4145 - Discrete Mathematics and TDT4113 - Programming Project.

otherCompanies.name: Foodora
otherCompanies.description: Food delivery cyclist. A mix of exercise and income was a great combination for a part time job alongside the studies.

otherCompanies.name: Me
otherCompanies.description: Working part time as a bartender was a really fun experiece. And besides, being good at making drinks is a "surprisingly" useful skill.

otherCompanies.name: Norwegian Army
otherCompanies.description: One year in the Norwegian Air Defence Battalion, honing both self discipline and communication skills.
